title: War in Ukraine: Trump could meet with Putin 'as soon as next week'
subhead: US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff met with the Russian leader on Wednesday to try to convince him to agree to a ceasefire with Ukraine before the August 8 deadline set by the White House. Moscow is considering a concession to delay sanctions on its oil exports.

title: 'The real villain of World War II': Winston Churchill is now a target of American revisionism
subhead: A new rewriting of history about the former British prime minister is gaining traction in the United States, especially among President Donald Trump's MAGA base.

title: The scars of Boko Haram on the shores of Lake Chad: 'At night, they are the masters'
subhead: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (2/4). Fifteen years after the insurgency began, successor factions of the jihadist group, though weakened, continue to spread terror around Lake Chad, which borders Niger, Nigeria, Cameroon and Chad.
byline: By Carol Valade (Lac province [Chad], special correspondent)

Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
subhead: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.

title: Eva Nguyen Binh, head of the Institut Français: 'Attacking culture has long-term consequences'
subhead: The president of the Institut Français, a French overseas cultural policy actor which has just had its contract renewed, discusses the challenges that cultural diplomacy faces in a time of geopolitical tensions.

title: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
subhead: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.
byline: By Philippe Mesmer (Hiroshima and Nagasaki, special correspondent)
